intro: Talinum triangulare, commonly known as red-rooted spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features triangular-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, pink to red flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Talinum triangulare is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
